PACKARD MOTOR CAR COMPANY. INC.
NEW YORK ZONE OFFICE
Telephone
Columbus 5-3900
1861 Broadway
New York 23, New York
December, 1953
Mr. Harold M. Bixby
956 Fifth Avenue
New York, New York
Dear Mr. Bixby:
This new stamp is sent to you from the United Nations and commemorates
Human Rights Dayâ€¢
Its purpose is to further the thought that knowledge
opens the door to understanding among men.
This First Issue comes just at the right time, because it gives me the
opportunity of sending you my warmest Holiday greetings.
And it also affords me the opportunity of giving your family one of the
finest Christmas presents they could wish for -- a brand new Packard
motor car.
To keep in the Holiday mood, I intend to make you a Christmas present
of the finest automobile deal you ever made in your life.
The amount
of money I will save you on a new car, and the generous trade-in offer
that I intend to make to you, will start your New Year off right.
So let me have your old car, make your family a present
of a new Packard
for Christmas, and come in so that I can offer you one of the greatest
money saving deals in our history.
Let's you and I celebrate.
I can celebrate by putting you in a brand
new Packard...and you can celebrate by saving a lot of money on a new
car.
Please telephone CO. 5-3900 and let me tell you about the deal I have
in mind for you.
GWH: ebs
Sincerely yours,
N. Vla
Norge W. Harrison
Retail Sales Manager
ASK
THE MAN WHO OWNS ONE
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover commemorating first day of issue for stamp honoring United Nations Human Rights Day; black printed cachet with image of two children; postmarked December 10, 1953 in New York over 3-cent stamp; no backstamp; addressed to Harold M. Bixby;a. envelope;b. insert.
